based GP records survey responses. household_overcrowding percentage households considered overcrowded, based                                 standard calculation comparing number required                                 rooms actual number rooms. life_expectancy Period life expectancy birth average number years                          person born specific year area live experienced                          area's current age-specific mortality rates throughout life. life_satisfaction average life satisfaction score respondents aged 16 . low_level_crime number police-recorded low-level crimes per 1,000 people,                          bicycle theft shoplifting used indicators overall rates. mental_health_conditions percentage people reporting mental health condition,                                   depression anxiety- based GP records                                   survey responses. overweight_and_obesity_in_adults percentage adults (18+) overweight                                           obese, based self-reported height weight survey. overweight_and_obesity_in_children percentage children Reception (aged 4-5)                                             Year 6 (aged 10-11) overweight obese. physical_activity percentage adults (19+) reporting physical activity 150 minutes                            per week. rough_sleeping number people sleeping outdoors single night October November,                         per 100,000 residents. smoking percentage adults (18+) currently smoke cigarettes. unemployment percentage adults (16+) actively seeking work past four                       weeks available start within two weeks, relative economically                       active population. young_ppl_edu_empl_appren percentage 16 17-year-olds sustained education,                                    employment, apprenticeships one year key stage 4 (                                   school Year 11).

what: Install R packages relevant for the book 'R for Non-Programmers: A Guide for Social Scientists'. — install_r4np
title: Install R packages relevant for the book 'R for Non-Programmers: A Guide for Social Scientists'. — install_r4np
text: Install R packages relevant book 'R Non-Programmers: Guide Social Scientists'.

title: Install R packages relevant for the book 'R for Non-Programmers: A Guide for Social Scientists'. — install_r4np
Install R packages relevant for the book 'R for Non-Programmers: A Guide for Social Scientists'. — install_r4np
text: Installs following R packages : broom: Turns output functions tibbles. car: Interpret regression results correlation: Lightweight package computing different kinds                       correlations, partial correlations, Bayesian                       correlations, multilevel correlations, polychoric correlations,                       biweight correlations, distance correlations . effectsize: Provide utilities work indices effect size                      standardized parameters wide variety models,                      allowing computation conversion indices Cohen's d,                      r, odds, etc. exact2x2: Provides function compute exact McNemar Test. ggdist: ggplot2 extension plot uncertainty frequencies. ggforce: ggplot2 extension plot even geoms. ggmosaic: Creates mosiac plots ggplot2. Useful visualising contingency tables ggraph: Used build network graphs ggridges: ggplot2 extension build ridge plots janitor: main janitor functions can: perfectly f                   ormat data.frame column names; provide quick                   counts variable combinations (.e., frequency                   tables crosstabs); isolate duplicate records. jtools: collection tools author (Jacob) written                  purpose efficiently understanding sharing results                  (primarily) regression analyses. lavaan: Fit variety latent variable models, including confirmatory factor analysis,                  structural equation modeling latent growth curve models. lubridate: Helps manipulate/convert date time data igraph: Used combination ggraph create network plots mice: Multiple imputation using Fully Conditional Specification (FCS)               implemented MICE algorithm described Van Buuren               Groothuis-Oudshoorn (2011). mi: Provides functions data manipulation, imputing missing values              approximate Bayesian framework, diagnostics models used              generate imputations, etc. modelr: Build pipefriendly operations model data. naniar: Provides data structures functions                  facilitate plotting missing values examination                  imputations. parameters: Returns parameters regression models. patchwork: Combine different ggplots one plot. performance: Returns performance indices regression models psych: general purpose toolbox personality, psychometric theory                 experimental psychology. pwr: Compute statistical power different analytical approaches rcompanion: Additional functions, effect sizes. rstatix: pipe-friendly way computing various common statistics. scales: Useful functions format ggplot axes. see: Enables visualising output easystats packages. simputation: Offer imputation methods missing data. skimr: simple use summary function can used pipes                 displays nicely console. tidyverse: Install core tidyverse packages. wesanderson: Colour palettes inspired Wes Anderson movies ggplot2 wordcloud: Generates word clouds text data.

title: Install R packages relevant for the book 'R for Non-Programmers: A Guide for Social Scientists'. — install_r4np
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Run this line of code to install all relevant packages install_r4np() } # }

text: df dataframe containing data tested. cols vector column names dataframe tested normality.

title: Perform normality test for multiple variables at once — ntest
text: dataframe test results. row corresponds variable,  columns contain test statistics p-values.

title: Perform normality test for multiple variables at once — ntest
text: function first reshapes dataframe long format  calculates sample size variable. checks sample  size variable less 3 greater 5000, , aborts  function error message `shapiro.test()` expects  range observations. function performs Shapiro-Wilk test  variable returns formatted dataframe test results.

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Perform multiple normality tests at once ntest(df   = mtcars,       cols = mpg) } # }

title: Perform normality test for multiple variables by groups — ntest_by

text: df dataframe containing data tested. cols vector column names dataframe tested normality. group column name dataframe defines groups.

title: Perform normality test for multiple variables by groups — ntest_by
text: data frame results Shapiro-Wilk test group   variable.

title: Perform normality test for multiple variables by groups — ntest_by
text: function first creates subsets data group.   performs Shapiro-Wilk normality test (`shapiro.test()`)   group returns results tidy format. function also checks   whether number observations variable group lies within   permissible range `shapiro.test()`. , function   provide diagnostics test performed base   groups affected.

title: Perform normality test for multiple variables by groups — ntest_by
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Perform a normality test for groups ntest_by(df    = mtcars,          cols  = mpg,          group = cyl)  # Perform a normality test for multiple variables by groups ntest_by(df    = starwars,          cols  = c(mass, birth_year),          group = species) } # }

People and Nature Survey for England, 2020-2023 — pplnat
text: data frame 3585 rows 19 variables: region Different regions England data collected. wave Data collected several waves. provides opportunities analyse data time. time_in_green Item: last 12 months, often, average spent free time                        outside green natural spaces? ncs_easy_walking_distance Item: much agree disagree following statements                                    relating green natural spaces locally: Within easy walking distance.                    | 1 ("Strongly disagree") 5 = ("Strongly agree"). ncs_relax_unwind Item: much agree disagree following statements relating                           green natural spaces locally: Places can relax unwind.                    | 1 ("Strongly disagree") 5 = ("Strongly agree"). ncs_high_enough_standard Item: much agree disagree following statements                                   relating green natural spaces locally: high enough standard want                                   spend time .                    | 1 ("Strongly disagree") 5 = ("Strongly agree"). imp_protect_environment Item: important protecting environment personally?                    | 1 ("important") 5 = ("important"). concerned_damaging_environment Item: much agree disagree following                                         statement? concerned damage natural environment.                    | 1 ("important") 5 = ("important"). pick_up_litter Item: often actions opportunity?                         see litter, pick .                    | 1 ("Never") 5 = ("Always / whenever opportunity"). vote_political_party Item: often actions opportunity?                               vote political parties strong environmental policies                    | 1 ("Never") 5 = ("Always / whenever opportunity"). change_lifestyle Item: going make changes lifestyle protect environment                           (example recycling rather throwing things away, using car less                           buying local food)? wb_lonely Item: often feel lonely?                   | 1 ("Never") 5 = ("Often / always"). wb_satisfied Item: Overall, satisfied life nowadays?                   | 1 ("") 10 = ("Completely"). wb_worthwhile Item: Overall, worthwhile things life?                   | 1 ("") 10 = ("Completely"). wb_happy Item: happy feeling yesterday?                   | 1 ("") 10 = ("Completely"). wb_worried_anxious Item: anxious feeling yesterday?                   | 1 ("") 10 = ("Completely"). wb_worried_anxious_r reverse-scored item `wb_worried_anxious`. ncs Natural connectedness scale (latent variable based `ncs` items).              higher score implies higher natural connectedness. wellbeing Wellbeing (latent variable based `wb` items).                    higher score implies higher wellbeing
